page.title: 18Employment.
page.content: Stainforth in 1985 has a very limited range of employment. The pit is the major local employer with around 1300 employees.Our small survey of 67 families showed that about 40% were without work.Many people have to find work outside the village.As you might expect with a population of 7,500 some work in local factories such as Rockware(glass jars)and the rapidly shrinking International Harvesters the tractor and farm equipment manufactures.A number of people work in the nearby power stations at Thorpe Marsh and Drax. Small business concerns do carry on: Stainforth Fashion Industries and Plumb Waste Paper Collection Services, but the Chicken Factory has closed. New firms such as Multiform,a young peoples cooperative making functional framed furniture,offer hope.
